page.title: 17CHURCH AND CUSTOMS R ABBOTT
page.content: The Church of Gittisham is called St. michaels. It has box pews which were installed in 1715.The Nave and Chancel is divided by an arch thought to be built just before 1330 and restored later. We have a Sunday School which is held in the church. Which is run by the mothers. Tip-Tip-toeing is a very old tradition inGitisham. It has been going for such a long time now that our grandparents cannot tell us when it started. For they also used to go tip-tip-toeing as well and it had been going for quite some time then. The children go from door to door saying "Tip-Tip Toe, Tip Tip Toe, Please for a penny and then we'll go." The door opened and give the children a few pence then they go on. This has always been held on Pancake day and the WI give the children tea before they start.
